listing.description: You will be pleasantly surprised when you step into this beautifully presented family home that has been extensively refurbished and thoughtfully extended to cater for today's informal style of living with a useful guest cloakroom and a large open plan kitchen/diner/family room across the rear. This is a lovely light and airy room, with bi-fold doors opening onto the garden and a large roof lantern that floods the room with natural light. The kitchen area has been beautifully appointed with a range of contemporary style units with contrasting granite work surfaces including a large central island. There is a comprehensive range of integrated appliances including an induction hob with a stainless steel cooker hood over, double oven, fridge/freezer, washing machine and dishwasher. To the rear there is ample space for a large dining table and sofa. To the front is the elegant southerly facing living room that makes a quiet retreat away from the family and retains its open fireplace fitted with a limestone surround and gas/coal effect fire creating a focal point to the room. To the first floor are three bedrooms, the two principal double rooms having built-in wardrobes. Completing the accommodation is the attractively refitted bathroom with a modern 4 piece white suite including a separate shower cubicle. Council Tax Band: E
listing.short_description: A traditional 1930’s 3 bedroom family home that has been beautifully extended and refurbished, giving that contemporary twist and providing excellent entertaining space for today’s informal style of living. Complemented by a large mature garden backing onto playing fields and a sought after position within a short stroll of Lower Sunbury village, station and the catchment of reputable schools. EPC Rating:

listing.description: This traditional 1930's double fronted detached bungalow offers generously proportioned accommodation. The property is in a clean and tidy condition yet is dated in its fitment and provides excellent potential for extension and refurbishment, which has been taken into consideration within the asking price. A useful entrance porch opens into a large hallway that sets the scene. The spacious living room is a lovely room retaining its attractive open inglenook fireplace inset with two stained glass windows; to the rear, a casement door opens onto the rear garden. Adjoining is the kitchen/breakfast room that also overlooks the garden; it has been fitted to a basic standard and includes the usual appliances. To the front are 2 double bay fronted bedrooms, the main having a wide double-glazed bay window and ample space for freestanding furniture. The 3rd bedroom is a good-sized single with a range of wall-to-wall mirror fronted built-in wardrobes. Completing the accommodation is the bathroom and separate WC are fitted with a matching pastel coloured 3-piece suite. Council Tax: Band E
listing.short_description: A traditional 3 bedroom detached bungalow with a lovely homely atmosphere and retaining much of its original character. Today it would benefit from modernisation and offers excellent potential to extend (subject to the usual planning consents). Set in large mature gardens within one of Lower Sunbury's premier crescents, only half a mile from the village centre and reputable schools. EPC Rating: D

Located at the bottom of Wilmot Way, this fabulous property is great for those looking for fast access to train and bus links whilst still being in easy walking distance of Banstead Village and highly regarded local schools within catchment such as Banstead Infants and Juniors and The Beacon High School. It's first time to market in more than two decades, this beautiful family home has been kept to a very high standard by its existing owners and offers two large reception rooms and a large kitchen/diner to the ground floor and three good sized bedrooms and a pristine family bathroom to the second. To the rear of the property there is a huge 130ft plus garden and to the front a garage and driveway. This genuinely is a beautiful and much loved home that is now ready for its next adventure. Book your viewing now to experience a fabulous family home that smells as scrumptious as it looks.

Lounge (17' 5'' x 13' 1'' (5.3m x 4m))

Recently refurbished this large, bright lounge overlooks the front of the property and benefits from a large bay window that floods the room with fantastic natural light.

2nd Reception/Dining Room (14' 1'' x 11' 6'' (4.3m x 3.5m))

Overlooking and offering patio door access to the huge rear garden, this fabulous second reception is bright and warm and could be used as either a second reception/playroom or formal dining room.

Kitchen / Diner (13' 5'' x 14' 9'' (4.1m x 4.5m))

Cleverly extended, this fantastic kitchen/diner is modern and in immaculate condition throughout. Managing to offer enough space to accommodate a large dining table whilst also offering direct access to the garden, this is a heart of the home kitchen that family and friends will love to gather in.

Master Bedroom (17' 5'' x 11' 10'' (5.3m x 3.6m))

The immaculate and spacious theme continues with this fabulous master bedroom. Benefiting from a beautiful bright bay window, this stunning master is large enough to accommodate even the largest of bedroom furniture and still leave plenty of space.

Bedroom 2 (14' 1'' x 11' 10'' (4.3m x 3.6m))

Another huge double, this bright and sunny bedroom overlooks the rear of the property and again is in pristine condition throughout.

Bedroom 3 (10' 6'' x 7' 7'' (3.2m x 2.3m))

This is not a box room! Larger than the average single in properties of this type, this good sized single does accommodate a full sized bed, wardrobe and chest of drawers.

Family Bathroom (10' 10'' x 7' 7'' (3.3m x 2.3m))

Presented to a very high standard, this gorgeous family bathroom offers both a shower cubicle and a bath as well as WC and vanity sink unit.

Landing (9' 6'' x 7' 7'' (2.9m x 2.3m))

Entrance Hall (17' 9'' x 7' 10'' (5.4m x 2.4m))

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: Views of Wellington ParkOne of only 41 townhouses on Royal Arsenal the house offers versatile accommodation over 3 floors and is extremely flexible in terms of use.You could have three double bedrooms and two reception rooms or four double bedrooms and one reception or of course two double bedrooms and 3 receptions - the choice is yours!From the hallway you gain access to the kitchen, downstairs WC and the dining/family room.The kitchen is at the front of the house and as has a good range of cupboards with modern work tops above and built in appliances to include a gas hob with extractor above, electric oven, fridge, freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, so you just need a kettle and away you go!The dining/family room is a good size with wood flooring which runs through from the hallway with glazed doors giving access to the rear garden.The first floor gives access to the main bathroom, one of the double bedrooms which over looks the rear garden and either the living room or 4th bedroom looking out towards Wellington Park, an acre of open space.The second floor brings you to the master bedroom with a ensuite shower and a further double bedroom.The master bedroom is a good size with a built-in wardrobe and space beside it for drawer units or further wardrobe space if needed. There is an ensuite connected.Outside the property has a rear garden with paved patio area leading to the lawn area and there is a driveway to the front of the house to park one vehicle and an option to have a permit to park along the kerbside of Hastings Street as well.These houses are always popular as there are so few of them on the Royal Arsenal Development so please call today to view!Ground Rent Approx: £200Service Charge Approx: £1550Lease: Approx 981 years remainingAll figures are approximate DimensionsGround FloorKitchen: 9ft 9” x 8ft 4” (2.97mx 2.54m)Reception Room: 15ft 2” x 12ft 7” (4.62m x 3.84m)Cloakroom1st FloorBedroom 4/ Living Room: 12ft 11” x 13ft 0” (3.94m x 3.96m)Bedroom 2: 12ft 6” x 8ft 10” (3.81m x 2.69m)Bathroom:2nd FloorMaster Bedroom: 13ft 3” x 12ft 6” (4.04m x 3.81m)Ensuite Shower RoomBedroom 3: 12ft 6” x 8ft 11 (3.81m x 2.72m)Rear GardenParking-Off StreetParking-On StreetTotal Area: 1129sqft - 104.9sqmAll measurements are approximateProperty Hot SpotThe Woolwich Royal Arsenal is one of the most exciting redevelopment and rejuvenation projects in London. The Royal Arsenal has already established a village community that is set to grow and improve beyond recognition. It was a former military barracks, parade ground and munitions storage and factory site dating from 1761 and is built on wide open spaces that have been beautifully landscaped on the banks of the Thames. It already has an established village community with significant commercial/social infrastructure that is set to grow and improve beyond recognition over the next few years once Crossrail is up and running.This is your chance to be part of the next London property hot spot at entry-level prices, allowing you to benefit from great value for money and exciting potential capital gains.Onsite AmenitiesThe Royal Arsenal is a beautiful, private riverside gated development with:24-House Concierge, Parcel Reception and Security.Onsite Parks and Riverwalks Boulangerie Jade - Bakery and Cafe Dry Cleaning ServicesMassage SalonYoung's Brewery Gastro Pubs - The Dial Arch and The GuardhouseFarmers' MarketCar Hire and Electric Vehicle Charging PointsTesco Express, Marks and Spencer's Food and Sainsbury's LocalCon Gusto Italian RestaurantMedical Centre with gp's Surgery and PharmacyPrivate DentistChildren's Nursery and DaycareChildren's Activity CentreThe Taproom Craft Brewery and Pub and Restaurant7R Gym and CrossfitRoyal Arsenal Boot CampsStephen James Car Showroom Travel and Shopping5 to 10 minutes' walk from Woolwich's high street, cafes and market. Royal Arsenal is the perfect place for anyone waiting to trade crowded Central London for space and style while keeping within easy commuting distance.Crossrail Station - Projected opening date - December 2018. The station is on the development and will take circa 10 minutes to Canary Wharf, 15 minutes to Liverpool Street and 25 minutes to Bond Street. It will be direct to Heathrow. By December 2019 it will connect all the way to Reading.Train - 5 minute walk to Woolwich Arsenal Station and 20 to 30 minutes into the city centre - London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross StationsDLR - 5 minute walk to Woolwich Arsenal DLR station and around 25 minutes into London’s Bank Station. Trains run approximately every 4 minutes. Destinations include City Airport 5 minutes, Canary Wharf 19 minutes and Stratford 23 minutes.Tube - North Greenwich station - Jubilee Line is easily accessible by bus and boat, or Canning Town on the DLRBoat - Thames Clippers - The river boat takes you to Canary Wharf in approximately 23 minutes and many stops through to Central London and Waterloo Visit for information and timetable.It's perfect for the 02, Canary Wharf, City and West End. London City Airport is only two stops away by DLR - its close enough for convenience but Royal Arsenal does not have any overhead flights.Future plans for the Royal Arsenal Huge investment is being made on the Royal Arsenal development, including onsite restaurants and wine bars, new retail space, a new hotel, Elizabeth Line Cross Rail Station opening 2018 and the newly announced Dash Arts Cultural Centre, a theatre and arts arena coming in 2019/2020.Regeneration of WoolwichA new Civic Centre on Wellington Street provides a new library, post office and cafe/bar. Behind the centre a brand-new Tesco superstore has recently opened alongside a town centre car park and 1000 new homes. The Tesco store is an eco-store powered by solar panels and wind turbines, and has a farmers' market selling local produce, and two children's playgrounds.At the western end of Powis Street, there is a designated development are known as the Woolwich Triangle - construction will soon commence for a new shopping centre with a major retailer taking centre stage. The Triangle development will include a leisure space, cafes and restaurants. The whole area covers an area of 300,000sqft and will revitalise the whole western end of the Town Centre as a car-free zone. Woolwich gets its own 'West End'. In fact British Land recently spent £100M acquiring land and buildings in Woolwich.The High Street will also benefit from the restoration of the existing Grade II listed buildings to give extra character and focus. The old Co-op building has now been refurbished with more buildings to be done. Once refurbished these historic buildings will accommodate new retail brands and major high street names, the whole area will become more vibrant during the day and in to the evening with new coffee bars and restaurants.£6.6million was recently spent on the redesign of General Gordon Square and Beresford Square near to the Woolwich Arsenal DLR and Train stations. This is now complete, and features include new landscape planting, seating areas, a large digital media display for sporting and public events and a new water feature.Please note: Care is taken in preparing the property details, dimensions and photos, however the accuracy of all the above is in no way guaranteed nor do these details form part of any contract. Prospective purchasers are advised to check all details via their solicitors.

listing.letting_fees:
At The Start Of A Tenancy:

GBP108.00 including VAT per tenant for references
GBP150.00 including VAT for the tenancy agreement
GBP60.00 including VAT for each guarantor if required

The Fee Is For:
Reference applications. These include credit checks, employer references, previous landlord or character references.
Submitting the references to your prospective landlord for approval.
Preparation of the tenancy agreement (including draft agreement) and negotiation of additional clauses.
Preparation of the deed of guarantee if applicable.
General administration.

Inventory Check In:
This fee is available on request and will vary depending on the size of the property and whether the property is furnished or unfurnished. The check in will be carried out by an independent inventory clerk and the fee is only applicable if the landlord opts to have a professional inventory carried out.

During And At The End Of A Tenancy:
The cost to renew the tenancy agreement will be GBP36.00 including VAT. This fee is for negotiating the new term and preparing the renewal document.

The cost to make any amendments to the tenancy agreement during a tenancy will be GBP60.00 including VAT.

At the end of a tenancy the tenant may be required to arrange professional cleaning or pay a check out fee. These fees vary depending on the size of the property and whether it is furnished or unfurnished.

Websters Estate Agents are members of the Tenancy Deposit Scheme (tds) and are regulated by The Property Ombudsman and the Association of Residential Lettings Agents (ARLA).

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property, there are various costs that you will need to take into consideration when making an offer.

Below, we have outlined the applicable charges payable when renting a home from Chestertons:

- Tenant administration fee: £222 (inc. VAT) This is payable after your offer has been accepted and we have proceeded to draw up a tenancy agreement.
- Reference fee for each Tenant or Guarantor: £42. This is payable when you have agreed to undergo the independent referencing process. References are carried out by an independent Third Party.
- Renewal administration fee: £96 (inc. VAT). This is payable upon renewal, should you and your landlord mutually agree to renew the tenancy for a further term.
- Inventory charges. In most lets, tenants will be responsible for paying for the inventory check out costs upon ending a tenancy. The cost is approximately £95 - £250 (Plus VAT) dependent on the size of the property. When budgeting prior to your home search, do not forget to also factor in your Tenancy Deposit, which is usually the equivalent of 6 weeks' rent. Tenants will also normally be responsible for paying for a professional clean at the end of the tenancy.

Should you have any queries regarding the charges and costs associated with renting a property, please do not hesitate to contact one of our lettings consultants who shall be happy to explain these in further detail.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: Detailed DescriptionA beautifully presented four bedroom house which has been recently refurbished throughout. The accommodation is arranged over three floors and features a stunning open plan kitchen / diner with high end appliances, contemporary bathroom, bedroom with en suite shower room and a southerly facing rear garden. This would be an ideal property for someone looking for a professionally renovated and refurbished home.LocationElm Close is a quiet cul de sac of similar properties, ideally situated just a short walk from Buckhurst Hill and Roding Valley Central Line stations with its direct links to the City, Canary Wharf and West End. Queens Road's cafes, restaurants, boutique shops and Waitrose Supermarket are a similar walk away. The area is well served with both state and independent schools, with Buckhurst Hill Community Primary School close by. For leisure pursuits, there is Epping Forest, Roding Valley Nature Reserve, tennis and cricket clubs and a David Lloyd Club all within easy reach.InteriorThere is a welcoming entrance hall with attractive wood style flooring which extends to much of the ground floor, with a handy storage cupboard and a guest cloakroom. To the front of the house is a separate lounge tastefully decorated in neutral colours and with cafe shutters. The kitchen / diner is a bright and stylish room which is sure to be the main hub of the house ideal for a family lifestyle. The kitchen area is fitted with white gloss units with quartz worktops. There are high end integral appliances including oven, microwave, induction hob and dishwasher. The dining area is a good space and has French doors leading onto the garden patio. The first floor has a spacious landing with a good size built in storage cupboard. There are three well appointed bedrooms on this floor all served by a contemporary family bathroom. The top floor has a further bedroom with a superb en suite shower room.ExteriorThe front garden provides off street parking. The delightful and southerly facing rear garden is well maintained with an extensive flagstone patio and lawn area.
listing.short_description: A beautifully presented four bedroom house with accommodation over three floors. Featuring a stunning open plan kitchen / diner with high end appliances, contemporary bathroom, bedroom with en suite shower room and a southerly facing rear garden

listing.description: A modern house located in a quiet mews in the heart of the Nightingale Triangle. This two double bedroom house has been fully refurbished to an impeccable standard recently and benefits from off street parking and a private south west facing garden. Both Wandsworth Common & Clapham Common are moments away along with all the amenities of nearby Balham and Northcote Road. Boasting a wonderful balance of living and entertaining the spacious reception room benefits from hardwood flooring throughout and direct access to a well groomed sunny garden. To the front of the property you have a beautifully refurbished kitchen with an array of bespoke fitted units and granite worktops.On the first floor you find two generous double bedrooms and an impeccably finished family bathroom. The master bedroom is adorned with wall to wall mirrored wardrobes. This house benefits from loft which ideal for storage.Linnet Mews is a quiet development tucked away at the end of Western Lane. The property is ideally placed for many of the local shops and restaurants on both Northcote Road and Bellevue Road. Access north of the river and The City can be achieved from either Clapham South underground station (Northern Line Zone 2), or Wandsworth Common mainline station that links via Clapham Junction to Victoria and Waterloo. The wide open spaces of Clapham and Wandsworth Common are also nearby.

listing.description: Light, Bright and Spacious Two Bedroom Period House with Garden and Basement - chain freeThis unique two bedroom house, once a Victorian shop, has been deftly redesigned to host two large living spaces, a separate kitchen, two double bedrooms and a bright and bold bathroom. There is a lovely rear patio garden which is a welcome haven from the stress of daily life and an enormous basement with over five feet head height - great for storage. Locally, there is plenty to shout about - you're within a minute's stroll of a Tesco Express for milk and a paper on a Sunday. The wonderful refurbished Burgess Park is three minutes on foot and Camberwell and Peckham are but a brief ramble. A minute's stroll will bring you to the bus stop that whisks you to Elephant and Castle in under 10 minutes!Enter off the street into a neat entrance hall with beautiful floorboards and crisp neutral decor. The first living space is light and lovely with built-in book shelves, fitted storage and a neat curving staircase. The repositioning of the stairwell has created a vast amount of extra living space and you can even position a dining table with plenty of space leftover. Glass pane doors open rear to a second reception with more tasty timber floors, wood-burner (compliant with stringent clean air laws), storage space and a view of the garden. The kitchen runs off from here with solid wood worktops, a large ceramic sink with mixer tap, contemporary cabinets and a lofty vaulted ceiling with two skylights. French doors run from here onto your cute garden - the perfect haven from the bustle of London.Ascending those sleek, solid and stylish curving stairs (with newly finished dark treads and beaming white risers) you reach a rectangular landing. The master bedroom fronts the street. There are fitted wardrobes hugging the chimney breast and more pale neutral wall shades. The second bedroom (also a great size) faces rear and is a bright space with more wooden floors. The bathroom sits in between with a clean white suite, heated towel rail and immaculate tiling.The daily commute is easy - grab the 343 bus (to London Bridge) on Wells Way or you can walk past the tennis courts and rose gardens of Burgess Park (which has undergone a £8 million reinvention) in under 10 minutes in order to access any number of buses to the West End and the City (jump off at Elephant & Castle for the Bakerloo and Northern lines). The 136 also goes to Elephant & Castle and connects to the overground line at Queen's Road Peckham and New Cross Gate in the other direction. It's also a 24hour bus! On a sunny day you can walk into Borough or the City - it's that close! The Pigeon Hole Cafe is a short ramble and we love Fowlds Cafe too - it's within a 10 minute amble. Even closer is the Flying Dutchman which offers regular social endeavours. Camberwell offers all the bars, restaurants and entertainments you could desire. We love the Hermit's Cave, The Crooked Well and the Camberwell Arms for a yummy roast. The South London Gallery is a must see! The varied delights of Bellenden Road are also within easy grasp. Peckham High Street also offers a multitude of treats for the discerning shopper.

listing.description: A stunning four bedroom, two bathroom, Victorian family home with parking and a garage, superbly located in a quiet cul de sac location within a short walk to Worcester Park High Street, Worcester Park British Rail and close to good local schools. The current owners have carefully and sympathetically refurbished the house to a very high standard throughout and in addition to practical updates the roof was replaced in 2015. This stylish home has four double bedrooms, a dining room and living room, a large kitchen, downstairs cloakroom, two bathrooms (one ensuite) and a tidy and manageable rear garden. Once through the front door and at the end of the hallway to the left is the dining room having a window overlooking the garden and interconnecting doors to the living room giving an open plan feel to both rooms. The living room has a lovely bay window to the front, a feature open hearth fireplace and built in shelving and cupboards, under the stairs has also built in storage space. The bright and modern kitchen is fully fitted with quartz work tops and a range of base and eye level units and drawers, space for an American fridge freezer, integrated washing machine and dishwasher, stainless steel built in electric double oven and a five ring gas hob. The down stairs cloakroom has a white low level flush WC, a vanity sink unit and a stainless steel heated radiator. Patio doors from the kitchen lead into a south facing manageable rear garden with decking area, artificial grass and a shed at the rear, also potential to extend to the side of the house (subject to the usual planning consents) with a gate at the side giving access to the front. Upstairs you will find two bedrooms, the fourth bedroom has fitted wardrobes either side with a window overlooking the garden, the spacious master bedroom is at the front of the house having two large windows and a range of fitted wardrobes, also an original open hearth cast iron fireplace. The luxury family bathroom has a white three piece bathroom suite, modern stainless steel radiators and a separate shower cubicle. Up another set of stairs and you will find a good size bedroom having double aspect windows, overlooking the side and the rear and stepping up further is another large double bedroom with two sky light windows and an ensuite shower room. This ideal family home which is superbly situated with a short walk to the local shops, restaurants and cafes of Worcester Park High street, including a Sainsbury's local and Waitrose supermarkets, offering easy access to Worcester Park br station and a good network of local transport, also close by are good local schools such as Cheam High School, Cheam Common Infants, Cheam Common Junior Academy and St. Cecilia's Catholic Primary School.
listing.short_description: A stunning four bedroom, two bathroom, Victorian period family home with parking and a garage, superbly located in a quiet cul de sac location, walking to Worcester Park High Street and Worcester Park British Rail and close to excellent local schools.

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:

Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

A deposit will be due on commencement of tenancy, calculated at 125% (1 & 1/4 times) the monthly rent, unless an additional amount is agreed, for example in relation to pets. This is to be held for the duration of tenancy and from which deduction may be made based on the findings of the inventory check-out or otherwise in respect of breach of contract.

A landlord will normally pay to have an inventory prepared and checked on commencement of tenancy, whilst a tenant will normally pay for an inventory check-out on termination of tenancy, currently typically between £70 - £110 dependent on size of property and subject to change over time.

We currently charge tenants £60 to prepare a tenancy agreement on renewal of tenancy, usually annually. This is subject to change over time.

listing.description: Please view our 360 images via the virtual tour linkGuide price £625,000 to £650,000The propertyThis is a 1930’s style terraced in an area sought after due to highly acclaimed schools. The house is move in ready although priced to allow for buyers to tweak to their own taste.The property offers potential to build a rear extension or into the loft space subject to any permissions required (although buyers should research permitted development rights as they may be able to build an extension without the need for planning consent).The house offers over 1000 sq ft of living space with two reception rooms providing flexibility of the living space. As an example, some buyers might use one of the reception rooms as a fourth bedroom which is especially appealing to anyone who is considering the future rental potential of the house.There are some period features such as fireplaces, round bay windows, high ceilings to name a few.There is much more to this property that can only be appreciated upon viewing, however the images do a fantastic job of showing you what’s on offer. Please also see our 360-degree images to give you more insight into what the property offers.SchoolsKilmorie and Rathfern schools which are both ofsted rated "Outstanding" and independent St Dunstan's College (3 - 18 years of age) are three out of several very well-regarded ofsted rated schools locally.Local recreation, transport and eating outFor those buyers who don’t know the area so well here is a summary of some of the local schools, transport and recreation found locally.Four train stations are located approximately 0.6 to 0.9 miles from the property and offer some of the following travel times to central London stations:London Bridge in approximately 15 minutesShoreditch in approximately 22 minutesVictoria in approximately 25 minutesCharing Cross in approximately 22 minutesSt Pancras in approximately 32 minutesCanary Wharf in approximately 32 minutesBlackfriars in approximately 22 minutesBus routes are available from the south circular which is at the end of the road. For late night travellers, night bus N171 runs from Tottenham Court Road through Waterloo, Elephant & Castle and stops along the south circular.Locally, there are numerous points of interest and some of the most popular include:The Horniman Museum and Gardens with regular events such as a farmer’s market, live music and seasonal festivals to name a few.You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens here:Blythe Hill Fields is also located in to local area and offers recreational facilities such as the "Trim trails" which is an exercise trail. It also hosts local events where the residents of SE23 and SE6 get to know each other better and enjoy the community spirit. You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:Some of the eateries nearby we know well are the award-winning Babur Indian restaurant. There's also the popular Mama Dough (Sour Dough) pizza restaurant and Le Querce - run by a Sardinian family serving traditional dishes.The Honor Oak pub (approximately .05 miles way) was refurbished a year or so ago and is now a popular gastropub with a beer garden out the back.Additional conveniences include the nhs doctors' surgery on the corner of St German's Road (located off the south circular), with a handy chemist located next door and a post office on the south circular.Local high streets include Honor Oak, Forest Hill and Catford, where you will find Sainsbury's, Tesco, your choice of boutique cafés, restaurants and trendy gastro pubs, as well as leisure centres, libraries and even the odd cocktail bar...In addition to Forest Hill and Honor Oak town centres, you could also use Catford town centre which is approximately 0.5 miles away. If you wanted to explore a greater selection of shops, eateries and social activity there are travel connections to the adjoining towns of Lewisham and Bromley both of which have shopping complexes and high streets with many well-known brand names, shops and restaurants.Please contact Hunters on to arrange your viewing.
listing.short_description: Guide £625,000 to £650,000. Approx 50 ft southerly facing garden, three bedrooms, freehold house, with two reception rooms, chain free, potential to build rear extension and loft conversion subject to permissions, in proximity of highly acclaimed schools.

As you make your way to the first floor, you will find three generously sized bedrooms, a modern fitted bathroom and a hallway that leads on to a larger than average loft conversion with a modern fitted en-suite.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.description: Detailed DescriptionStunning & fully refurbished four bedroom Victorian house found on the Corbett Estate in Catford. Located almost equidistant to Catford & Hither Green Stations & also less than approx 0.5 miles from five osted "Good" and "Outstanding" schools.The current owner has paid attention to detail in all areas & spared no expense. The following works have been carried out to the property by the owner;Fully rewired & the work has been certified by the National Inspection Council for Electrical Installation Contracting. CAT6 network points & TV points are also fitted. The property has been pre-wired for internal & external speakers, a burglar alarm & CCTV installation.Newly fitted gas central heating system with the balance of a 7 year parts & labour manufacturer guarantee.The flooring on the ground floor is a wood effect Karndean luxury vinyl tile laid in a framed herringbone pattern creating a parquet effect. The flooring comes with the balance of a 35 year manufacturer guarantee.Newly fitted double glazed windows & doors with the balance of a 10 year manufacturer guarantee.Fully fitted contemporary high gloss kitchen with a handleless slab door, integrated fridge freezer, oven, hob & extractor. Also features a stunning solid oak worktop.Modern fitted WC to the ground floor of the property.Modern fitted bathroom to the first floor of of the propety featuring metro tiles, p-shaped bath with a three way shower valve, an overflow bath filler & a glass shower screen.Newly fitted carpets to the stairs and first floor of the property.The property has been replastered internally & decorated featuring light neutral decor. The exterior of the property has been rendered to the front and rear using coloured render. The side elevation features exposed brickwork that has been repointed.A new resin finish will be laid to the front garden*The rear garden features newly fitted decking & will have new grass laid*A new composite front door will also be fitted*Gutters, downpipes and fascia boards have also been renewed.* These works were not complete at the time of listing the property as the weather had not permitted them to be completed. Expected completion date for the works in late March/early April 2019.

listing.description: The propertyLocated in the quiet residential area of Carshalton Beeches, this immaculate three-bedroom semi-detached family home has been recently refurbished throughout to a high standard by its current owners with no expense spared. With a large driveway, garage and 70ft rear garden and only 0.2 miles to Carshalton Beeches train station, this really is a great family house, with added potential to extend to the rear, side and loft.Downstairs – Two generously-sized reception rooms both with feature fireplaces and integrated remote-controlled Opti-Myst fires. The rear reception room has built-in bespoke white oak cupboards and floating shelves, with plenty of room for a large dining table and chairs, and door leading out into the wonderful rear garden. A separate modern fitted kitchen ensures any cooking aromas are contained – it features fully integrated A+ rated white goods (dishwasher, washing-machine & fridge-freezer), chrome Bosch wok-burner hob, oven and extractor.Upstairs – To the first floor, there are two double bedrooms, one to the front with a bay window; the second double bedroom overlooks the rear garden and has a feature fireplace to one side alongside integrated wardrobes. The third bedroom is slightly smaller and ideally used as a child's room or office/study. The stunning family bathroom is straight from a brochure, with an oversized bath, separate large shower, hand basin, w/c, ladder heated towel rail and integrated mirror storage units. Access to the insulated and boarded loft from the landing spans the whole of the property and makes for excellent storage space.Outside – A smart, well-landscaped front garden with decorative walls and matching driveway big enough any large suv. There is a useful porch for extra storage or all of those missed deliveries. A large garage with up and over door, with power points and lighting; can be used as a utility room, storage or easily converted into another room. This house boasts a mature landscaped two-sectioned garden, great for entertaining and plenty of space for the kids to play. The rear section of the garden captures the sun throughout the day.ExteriorBlock-paved drive for one large suv, lawn bordered by flowering hedges and low-level brick wallporchFully-enclosed porch with UPVC glazed door, casement windows to front aspect, tiled floor, external light fitting.HallwayUPVC decorative opaque panel-glazed door with decorative window adjacent and transom window above, oak laminate flooring, thick pile carpeted stairs to first floor with storage cupboard under, dome light fitting, radiator.Lounge 15'7 x 11'10 (4.75m x 3.61m)Space for three-piece suite and further furniture, bay casement windows with Venetian blinds over to front aspect, fireplace in stone, mantelpiece and integrated remote-controlled Opti-Myst fire, oak laminate flooring, recessed LED lighting, radiator.Dining room 13'5 x 11'3 (4.01m x 3.43m)Space for large dining table and further furniture, single French door to garden, two-full height windows with top-opening transom windows adjacent to rear aspect, chrome curtain pole with full-length curtains over to rear aspect, built-in wooden oak sideboard with floating shelves over to alcove, wall-mounted remote-controlled Opti-Myst fire, oak laminate flooring, recessed LED lighting, double radiator.Kitchen 10'2 x 7' (3.10m x 2.13m)Casement window with Venetian blind over to rear aspect, part-glazed opaque UPVC door to garden, laminated worktops to three walls, range of base units/cupboards/drawers, fully integrated kitchen featuring chrome Bosch wok gas-burner hob with extractor hood and electric oven, integrated dishwasher, integrated washing machine, full-sized fitted fridge-freezer, single stainless steel deep sink with water filter mixer tap, slate laminate flooring, recessed LED lighting with chrome dimmer control, sockets and splashback.Stairs to first floor & landingOpaque glazed fixed window on stairwell with Venetian blind over to side aspect, platform landing at foot, open wooden balustrade, thick pile carpeted, dome light fitting on switch, cupboard housing boiler, access to part-boarded and fully-insulated loft (with power & lighting) via hatch and fitted ladder.Bedroom 1 15'8 x 10'7 (4.78m x 3.23m)Space for a King-sized bed and further furniture, casement windows in bay with Venetian blinds over to front aspect, thick pile carpeted, zoned recessed LED lighting, radiator.Bedroom 2 13'6 x 10'7 (4.11m x 3.23m)Space for King-sized bed and further furniture, casement windows with Venetian blinds to rear aspect, fitted wardrobes to one wall, decorative fireplace, thick pile carpeted, recessed LED lighting, radiator.Bedroom 3  8'1 x 7' (2.46m x 2.13m)Space for single bed and further furniture, casement window with Venetian blinds to front aspect, thick pile carpeted, recessed LED lighting, radiator.Bathroom 10'2 x 6'11 (3.10m x 2.11m)Opaque casement window with Venetian blind to rear aspect, large walk-in glass shower cubicle with plumbed-in Mira thermostatic mixer shower and rainfall shower head, matching white bathroom suite and Hansgrohe fitments, oversized bath with chrome mixer tap and shower attachment, pedestal sink with mixer tap, dual-flush toilet, mirrored wall cabinets, quiet extractor fan, floor-to-ceiling tiled walls, waterproof laminate flooring, recessed LED lighting, chrome ladder towel rail, radiator.Garden 70’ approx. (22 metres)Patio, lawn, mature trees, shrubs and hedges, flower beds, full-height wooden fence, path, external water tap, external lighting, rcd switched power sockets, approximately 70ft.Garage 17'1 x 7'4 (5.21m x 2.24m)Wooden-clad roof structure with water resistant fiberglass coating, Novoferm up-and-over garage door, opaque casement window and part-glazed opaque UPVC door to garden, 2 strip lighting on switch, 3 double electricity/power supply points, laminate worktop.Low energy bills (energy-efficient)Energy saving features of this property:- New electrics with multiple sockets in each room, dimmer-controlled LED recessed lighting throughout (totalling 150w)- New pipework and radiators with trv’s throughout, A+ rated Vaillant boiler with wireless thermostat control- A+ rated energy efficient integrated kitchen appliances & white goods- Oak laminate flooring throughout the ground floor with Timbertech acoustic thermal underlay beneath- Luxury thick pile carpet with Tredaire thermal underlay from the stairway up to all bedrooms.LocationLocated in the popular area of Carshalton Beeches, there are plenty of transport links, shops and good schools close by.Carshalton Beeches train station is approx. 0.2 miles away and both Carshalton and Sutton train stations are within 0.7 miles all with links into London Victoria, London Bridge, Blackfriars and Clapham Junction.For schools, St. Mary's rc Junior School is within 0.5 miles and Stanley Park Infants and Junior School is within 0.6 miles.For secondary schools, St. Philomena's Catholic High School for Girls is within 0.4 miles and both Carshalton High School for Girls and Sutton Grammar School are within 0.8 miles.Carshalton Village is a lovely area with a good array of shops and amenities with the ponds and many parks nearby. For a greater range of shops and restaurants then Sutton town centre is only a short walk away.
listing.short_description: The property Located in the quiet residential area of Carshalton Beeches, this immaculate three-bedroom semi-detached family home has been recently refurbished throughout to a high standard by its current owners with no expense spared. With a large driveway, garage and 70ft rear garden and only 0.2 miles to Carshalton Beeches train station, this really is a great family house, with added potential to extend to the rear, side and loft. Downstairs – Two generously-sized reception rooms both with feature fireplaces and integrated remote-controlled Opti-Myst fires. The rear reception room has built-in bespoke white oak cupboards and floating shelves, with plenty of room for a large dining table and chairs, and door leading out into the wonderful rear garden. A separate modern fitted kitchen ensures any cooking aromas are contained – it features fully integrated A+ rated white goods (dishwasher, washing-machine & fridge-freezer), chrome Bosch wok-burner hob, oven and extractor. Upstairs – To the first floor, there are two double bedrooms, one to the front with a bay window; the second double bedroom overlooks the rear garden and has a feature fireplace to one side alongside integrated wardrobes. The third bedroom is slightly smaller and ideally used as a child's room or office/study. The stunning family bathroom is straight from a brochure, with an oversized bath, separate large shower, hand basin, w/c, ladder heated towel rail and integrated mirror storage units. Access to the insulated and boarded loft from the landing spans the whole of the property and makes for excellent storage space. Outside – A smart, well-landscaped front garden with decorative walls and matching driveway big enough any large suv. There is a useful porch for extra storage or all of those missed deliveries. A large garage with up and over door, with power points and lighting; can be used as a utility room, storage or easily converted into another room. This house boasts a mature landscaped two-sectioned garden, great for entertaining and plenty of space for the kids to play. The rear section of the garden captures the sun throughout the day. Exterior Block-paved drive for one large suv, lawn bordered by flowering hedges and low-level brick wall porch Fully-enclosed porch with UPVC glazed door, casement windows to front aspect, tiled floor, external light fitting. Hallway UPVC decorative opaque panel-glazed door with decorative window adjacent and transom window above, oak laminate flooring, thick pile carpeted stairs to first floor with storage cupboard under, dome light fitting, radiator. Lounge 15'7 x 11'10 (4.75m x 3.61m) Space for three-piece suite and further furniture, bay casement windows with Venetian blinds over to front aspect, fireplace in stone, mantelpiece and integrated remote-controlled Opti-Myst fire, oak laminate flooring, recessed LED lighting, radiator. Dining room 13'5 x 11'3 (4.01m x 3.43m) Space for large dining table and further furniture, single French door to garden, two-full height windows with top-opening transom windows adjacent to rear aspect, chrome curtain pole with full-length curtains over to rear aspect, built-in wooden oak sideboard with floating shelves over to alcove, wall-mounted remote-controlled Opti-Myst fire, oak laminate flooring, recessed LED lighting, double radiator. Kitchen 10'2 x 7' (3.10m x 2.13m) Casement window with Venetian blind over to rear aspect, part-glazed opaque UPVC door to garden, laminated worktops to three walls, range of base units/cupboards/drawers, fully integrated kitchen featuring chrome Bosch wok gas-burner hob with extractor hood and electric oven, integrated dishwasher, integrated washing machine, full-sized fitted fridge-freezer, single stainless steel deep sink with water filter mixer tap, slate laminate flooring, recessed LED lighting with chrome dimmer control, sockets and splashback. Stairs to first floor & landing Opaque glazed fixed window on stairwell with Venetian blind over to side aspect, platform landing at foot, open wooden balustrade, thick pile carpeted, dome light fitting on switch, cupboard housing boiler, access to part-boarded and fully-insulated loft (with power & lighting) via hatch and fitted ladder. Bedroom 1 15'8 x 10'7 (4.78m x 3.23m) Space for a King-sized bed and further furniture, casement windows in bay with Venetian blinds over to front aspect, thick pile carpeted, zoned recessed LED lighting, radiator. Bedroom 2 13'6 x 10'7 (4.11m x 3.23m) Space for King-sized bed and further furniture, casement windows with Venetian blinds to rear aspect, fitted wardrobes to one wall, decorative fireplace, thick pile carpeted, recessed LED lighting, radiator. Bedroom 3 8'1 x 7' (2.46m x 2.13m) Space for single bed and further furniture, casement window with Venetian blinds to front aspect, thick pile carpeted, recessed LED lighting, radiator. Bathroom 10'2 x 6'11 (3.10m x 2.11m) Opaque casement window with Venetian blind to rear aspect, large walk-in glass shower cubicle with plumbed-in Mira thermostatic mixer shower and rainfall shower head, matching white bathroom suite and Hansgrohe fitments, oversized bath with chrome mixer tap and shower attachment, pedestal sink with mixer tap, dual-flush toilet, mirrored wall cabinets, quiet extractor fan, floor-to-ceiling tiled walls, waterproof laminate flooring, recessed LED lighting, chrome ladder towel rail, radiator. Garden 70’ approx. (22 metres) Patio, lawn, mature trees, shrubs and hedges, flower beds, full-height wooden fence, path, external water tap, external lighting, rcd switched power sockets, approximately 70ft. Garage 17'1 x 7'4 (5.21m x 2.24m) Wooden-clad roof structure with water resistant fiberglass coating, Novoferm up-and-over garage door, opaque casement window and part-glazed opaque UPVC door to garden, 2 strip lighting on switch, 3 double electricity/power supply points, laminate worktop. Low energy bills (energy-efficient) Energy saving features of this property: - New electrics with multiple sockets in each room, dimmer-controlled LED recessed lighting throughout (totalling 150w) - New pipework and radiators with trv’s throughout, A+ rated Vaillant boiler with wireless thermostat control - A+ rated energy efficient integrated kitchen appliances & white goods - Oak laminate flooring throughout the ground floor with Timbertech acoustic thermal underlay beneath - Luxury thick pile carpet with Tredaire thermal underlay from the stairway up to all bedrooms. Location Located in the popular area of Carshalton Beeches, there are plenty of transport links, shops and good schools close by. Carshalton Beeches train station is approx. 0.2 miles away and both Carshalton and Sutton train stations are within 0.7 miles all with links into London Victoria, London Bridge, Blackfriars and Clapham Junction. For schools, St. Mary's rc Junior School is within 0.5 miles and Stanley Park Infants and Junior School is within 0.6 miles. For secondary schools, St. Philomena's Catholic High School for Girls is within 0.4 miles and both Carshalton High School for Girls and Sutton Grammar School are within 0.8 miles. Carshalton Village is a lovely area with a good array of shops and amenities with the ponds and many parks nearby. For a greater range of shops and restaurants then Sutton town centre is only a short walk away.

listing.description: This Chalet style home has undergone as extensive a refurbishment as it is possible to undergo from the replaced floorboards upwards. The property offers very flexible accommodation with upto five rooms which would make either great bedrooms or reception rooms.Towards the rear of the property is the 'Wow factor' open plan living space which has a fitted kitchen and steps down to a spacious lounge / dining room with windows and double doors to the garden across the back. There is a well placed skylight above this space which lets in lots of natural light.There are three further rooms on the ground floor and a shower room off of the welcoming entrance hallway, which also has a w/c.The family bathroom is found on the first floor and acts as an ensuite to the Master bedroom. This bedroom has a Juliette balcony offering a fantastic view of the local area. There are two bedrooms in total upstairs.This fantastic property is offered to the market with no chain by its Sole Agents.Stoneleigh is a highly sought after residential area with a bustling Broadway of shops and restaurants at its heart, as well as a mainline railway station with services to Waterloo every twenty minutes. There is a choice of infant and junior schools within the immediate vicinity and the Historic Nonsuch Park runs alongside the South East side.Both the M25 and A3 are easily accessible giving a straight forward route to London and both Heathrow and Gatwick international airports.FreeholdYou may download, store and use the material for your own personal use and research. There is a well placed skylight above this space which lets in lots of natural light. There are three further rooms on the ground floor and a shower room off of the welcoming entrance hallway, which also has a w/c.

The family bathroom is found on the first floor and acts as an ensuite to the Master bedroom. This bedroom has a Juliette balcony offering a fantastic view of the local area. There are two bedrooms in total upstairs. This fantastic property is offered to the market with no chain by its Sole Agents.

Stoneleigh is a highly sought after residential area with a bustling Broadway of shops and restaurants at its heart, as well as a mainline railway station with services to Waterloo every twenty minutes. There is a choice of infant and junior schools within the immediate vicinity and the Historic Nonsuch Park runs alongside the South East side. Both the M25 and A3 are easily accessible giving a straight forward route to London and both Heathrow and Gatwick international airports. Freehold

listing.description: This beautiful 4 Bedroom Terraced House is perfectly located in the affluent area of North Chingford, within walking distance to Chingford Station. This property is easily accessible to local shops, bars and amenities. The exceptional schools in the area make it very popular with young families and overall situated in the idyllic location.This delightful property has been fully refurbished to offer a bright front reception room followed on by a spacious separate open plan kitchen-diner that is fully equipped with all the necessary appliances; complete with quarts worktops. The kitchen leads onto a great size garden with access to a shed. In addition to this there is also access to a downstairs WC for convenience and wooden flooring throughout. The upstairs of the property offers 3 good size bedrooms and a modern fully tiled family size bathroom. The loft conversion of the property has a large double bedroom and a separate shower room.However, to really appreciate the size, location and condition an internal viewing is highly recommended.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: An excellent example of the modern and traditional fusion of style, this Artizan built Four Bedroom Victorian style of house is minutes away from Turnpike Lane and Wood Green Underground Station. The property makes a formidable claim for the best-refurbished house on the market in the Wood Green areaThe propertyWith no shortage of space, this home boasts approximately 1,300 sq ft. Of internal living space. Providing a canvass feel, ready for the new owner to come in and blanket with individual taste.Offering Three reception spaces; the first at the front of the property, full of light pulled in from its square bay window. An additional through lounge reception space that interlinks with the kitchen diner space. The large kitchen diner offers an excellent area for cooking, eating and entertaining with plenty of worktop and kitchen storage spaces. It is tiled with contemporary design splashbacks to add a touch of style. The garden has been paved for easy maintenance.The first floor consists of three of the properties bedrooms, blanketed with a white pallet to add to the already bright spaces. The final bedroom is found is the loft bedroom (built with relevant permissions) on the third floor.The property offers a lovely contemporary bathroom suite, the developer here has opted with distinctive tiling bordering and finished with floor to wall tiling. The bathtub is fitted with a dynamic jacuzzi system (it even has lights!) along with a vanity sink unit with inbuilt under-storage.The locationNoel Park Conservation area has flourished in the last five years, and it has now stamped itself as a highly desirable place to live in London. Established between 1883 and 1902 and built by the Artizan Company it offers residents a piece of Victorian history. It provides a vast choice of local shops and the quirky cafés/coffee shops, bars, music venues, leisure and art centres. If these do not meet the desires, then residents can take a short stroll to the UK renowned Alexandra Palace. Known to be a great day out, with places to dine and relax all through the day. A real landmark of our lovely City. Wood Green High Street is also in the property’s imminence. To just put it, nothing goes missed here. From household goods to major retailers and not forgetting great places to dine such as the famously known Tashish restaurant.The amenities do not stop there with this property, within 7 minutes you can reach Turnpike Lane and Wood Green Underground (Piccadilly Line Zone 3) which are found connected to the central shopping district of the patch. As well as the Undergrounds you have the array of different shops which include a Shopping Mall along with a range of diverse restaurant’s offering a variety of cuisines. When it comes to shopping and dining the Wood Green High Road is bound to meet all requirements, whether you are looking for clothing, household goods or groceries, there is nothing missed here.The property is sold chain free. Come and see it!Think…Property Inc!
